param_explanations.n_estimators: Controls the number of trees in the forest. More trees provide better accuracy but increase computation time.
param_explanations.max_depth: Maximum depth of each tree. None allows unlimited growth, while specific values prevent overfitting.
param_explanations.min_samples_split: Minimum samples required to split a node. Higher values prevent overfitting but might underfit.
param_explanations.min_samples_leaf: Minimum samples required in a leaf node. Higher values create more conservative trees.
param_explanations.max_features: Method for selecting features for splits. sqrt and log2 are common choices for classification.
param_explanations.bootstrap: Whether to use bootstrap samples. False means use whole dataset for each tree.
param_explanations.class_weight: Handling class imbalance. balanced adjusts weights inversely proportional to frequencies.

param_explanations.learning_rate: Controls the contribution of each tree. Lower values mean more conservative boosting.
param_explanations.max_depth: Maximum depth of trees. Deeper trees can model more complex patterns but may overfit.
param_explanations.n_estimators: Number of boosting rounds. More rounds might improve performance but may overfit.
param_explanations.subsample: Fraction of samples used for training each tree. Helps prevent overfitting.
param_explanations.colsample_bytree: Fraction of features used for training each tree. Controls feature selection.
param_explanations.min_child_weight: Minimum sum of instance weight in child. Controls tree splitting behavior.
param_explanations.gamma: Minimum loss reduction required for split. Higher values make algorithm more conservative.
param_explanations.reg_alpha: L1 regularization term. Helps create sparse trees.
param_explanations.reg_lambda: L2 regularization term. Helps stabilize the model.

param_explanations.learning_rate: Step size shrinkage to prevent overfitting. Lower values need more iterations.
param_explanations.num_leaves: Maximum number of leaves in one tree. Controls model complexity.
param_explanations.max_depth: Maximum depth of the tree. -1 means no limit.
param_explanations.n_estimators: Number of boosting iterations. More iterations might improve performance.
param_explanations.min_child_samples: Minimum number of data needed in a leaf. Controls overfitting.
param_explanations.min_child_weight: Minimum sum of instance weight in leaf. Similar to min_child_samples.
param_explanations.min_split_gain: Minimum gain to make a split. Controls tree growth.
param_explanations.subsample: Training instance sampling ratio. Helps prevent overfitting.
param_explanations.colsample_bytree: Feature sampling ratio for each tree. Controls feature selection.
param_explanations.reg_alpha: L1 regularization. Helps create sparse trees.
param_explanations.reg_lambda: L2 regularization. Helps create more conservative trees.
param_explanations.boosting_type: Algorithm type. DART often provides better accuracy but might be unstable.

param_explanations.hidden_layer_sizes: Architecture of hidden layers. More complex architectures can model more complex patterns.
param_explanations.activation: Activation function for hidden layers. ReLU is often default, tanh can work better for some cases.
param_explanations.alpha: L2 regularization term. Higher values mean stronger regularization.
param_explanations.learning_rate: Learning rate schedule for weight updates. Adaptive can be better for complex problems.
param_explanations.max_iter: Maximum number of iterations. Should be increased if model doesnt converge.
param_explanations.early_stopping: Whether to use early stopping to prevent overfitting.
param_explanations.validation_fraction: Fraction of training data to use for validation.
param_explanations.batch_size: Size of minibatches for training. Auto lets algorithm decide best size.
